discourse_list.title: My post was hidden because it was flagged by community

content.content: My post https://gov.uniswap.org/t/retroactive-airdrop-excludes-proxy-contract-users-e-g-dharma-matcha-etc/1222/184?u=neverselling was hidden because community flags. Was this a moderator hiding my post or just because people flagged it? I feel if someone identifies themselves and doesnt remain anonymous, they leave themselves open to public criticism through news articles. But thats ok, if the mods believe it violated a rule, no problem. However if it was hidden purely from being flagged by users, this raises the question of raids and opinion manipulation on here. So that would be yet another reason to vet new users or at least have flagged posts manually reviewed, say weekly, by mods.
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is questioning why their post was hidden and whether it was due to community flags or moderator action. They suggest that flagged posts should be manually reviewed by moderators to prevent opinion manipulation.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

content.content: Your post was more than likely flagged by multiple users. After reaching a threshold it was then hidden FYI: Your post also didnt contribute anything to the greater use of the forum or discussion, would make sure to read the banner and the rules to prevent yourself from being flagged more in the future
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving negative feedback on proposal
3rd party giving advice on how to avoid being flagged in the future

content.content: Please don’t make new topics for things like this… How about just send a private message to one of the moderators? Please see: https://gov.uniswap.org/t/delete-lock-the-stop-censoring-proposals-thread/5115/3. It’s not moderators doing this, it’s community members flagging it. It hides a post, it doesn’t lock/delete it. And, usually this is temporarily.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match
